chapter.p: 91 An oracle. The word of Yahweh is against the land of Hadrach,

ul.li1: and Damascus is its resting place.
ul.li2: For to Yahweh belongs the eye of humankind,“Eye of humankind” is difficult to understand in this context; some scholars emend the phrase to “cities of Aram” or “capital of Aram”
ul.li3: and all the tribes of Israel,
ul.li1: 2and also Hamath, which borders on it;
ul.li2: Tyre and Sidon—yes, they are very wise!That is, wise in their own eyes (ironic)
ul.li1: 3Tyre has built a fortification for itself,Hebrew “her”
ul.li2: and it heaped up silver like dust,
and gold like the mud of the streets.
ul.li1: 4Look! The Lord will drive itHebrew “her” out
ul.li2: and will hurl itsHebrew “her” outer ramparts into the sea,
ul.li3: and itHebrew “she” will be consumed by fire.
ul.li1: 5Ashkelon will see and will be afraid,
ul.li2: and Gaza will writhe exceedingly,
and Ekron also, because its hope is ruined.Traditionally “ashamed”; some presuppose a different Hebrew form and translate “withered”
ul.li1: And the king from Gaza will perish,
ul.li2: and Ashkelon will not be inhabited.
ul.li1: 6A mongrel peopleThat is, a people of mixed marriage; “half-breeds” will dwell in Ashdod,
ul.li2: and I will cut down the pride of the Philistines.
ul.li1: 7I will remove itsHebrew “his” blood from itsHebrew “his” mouth,
ul.li2: and itsHebrew “his” abominations from between itsHebrew “his” teeth.
ul.li1: And itHebrew “he” too will be a remnant for our God;
ul.li2: and itHebrew “he” will be like a tribal chiefThis word is sometimes interpreted as “clan” in Judah,
and Ekron will be like the Jebusite.
ul.li1: 8But I will encamp at my templeOr “house” like a guard,
ul.li2: against those crossing through and returning;
ul.li1: no oppressor will cross through them again,
ul.li2: for now I have seen with my own eyes.
ul.li1: 9Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion!
ul.li2: Shout aloud, O daughter of Jerusalem!
ul.li1: Look! Your king comes to you;
ul.li2: he is righteous and victorious,
ul.li1: humble and riding on a donkey,
ul.li2: and on a male donkey, the foal ofLiterally “the son of ” a female donkey!
ul.li1: 10And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim,
ul.li2: and the horse from Jerusalem;
ul.li1: the battle bow will be cut down,
ul.li2: and he will announce peace to the nations.
ul.li1: His dominion will be from sea to sea,
ul.li2: and from the RiverThat is, the Euphrates to the ends of the earth.
ul.li1: 11As for you also, because of the blood of your covenant,
ul.li2: I will release your prisoners from the waterless pit.Literally “the cistern there is not water in him”
ul.li1: 12Return to the fortress,
ul.li2: O prisoners of hope;
ul.li1: today I am declaring that I will repay you double.
13For I have bent Judah as my bow;
ul.li2: I have set Ephraim as an arrow.
ul.li1: I will set in motion your sons, O Zion,
ul.li2: against your sons, O Javan.That is, Greece
ul.li1: I will wield you like the sword of a warrior.
14Then Yahweh will appear over them,
ul.li2: and his arrow will go forth like lightning;
ul.li1: and my Lord Yahweh will blow the trumpet,
ul.li2: and he shall go out in the storm winds of the south.
ul.li1: 15Yahweh of hosts will defend them,
ul.li2: and they will devour and subdue the slingstones;Perhaps metonymy for the slingers of stones
ul.li1: they will drink, they will make noiseLXX reads “they will drink blood like wine” like wine,
ul.li2: and they will be full like the sacrificial basin,That is, the ceremonial bowl used by the priest for sprinkling blood
drenched like the corners of an altar.
ul.li1: 16And Yahweh their God will save them on that day,
ul.li2: as the flock of his people;
ul.li1: for they are like the stones of a diadem,
ul.li2: glittering on his land.
ul.li1: 17For how great is his goodness, and how great is his beauty!
ul.li2: Grain will make the young men thrive,
ul.li1: and new wine the young women.
